data.title: Cerealiq AB
data.meta_description:
Cerealiq AB | 277 f√∂ljare p√• LinkedIn. Cerealiq's technology warrants oat and pea drinks of high quality in a simplified process at low production costs. | Cerealiq AB is a food-tech company founded in 2018 in Sweden with the aim to support the fast-growing market of plant-based drinks; a business that the owners and founders, H√•kan, Emilie and Angie, have long experience within. 

Our focus is on drinks made from grains and pulses, where there is a need for the development of new products and processes. Cerealiq provides consultancy, development services and custom enzyme mixes as processing aids to customers worldwide, while we are continuously working on ideas and applying for patents regarding novel products and technologies.
data.text:
After a great first day at #Anuga, we are here to meet and discuss with you today and until the 11th of October. Come to our booth SA045 in the passage between halls 4 and 5 to meet Hakan Karlsson, J√∂rgen Kamph and Klelia Karagiannaki and taste some coffee with oat drink made with Cerealiq AB technology! We are happy to share our booth with Biostar PPHU Witold Krusz, who can guide you through an efficient production of plant-based dairy. #oatmilk

Meet our Quality Manager, Evelina √ñsterblad! During her BSc in Gastronomy at H√∂gskolan in Kristianstad Evelina engaged with a wide variety of courses such as HACCP, Food Chemistry and Nutrition. Having then worked as a chef, including raw food applications, she experienced this knowledge in practice and got inspired to create delicious food by adding only a few ingredients. Evelina started working with Quality Assurance in 2014, as a third-party Food Auditor at Valiguard/SAI Global. During this role, she had responsibility for more than 150 restaurants all over Scandinavia and she gained expertise in Food Quality, Food Safety, Hygiene and Education of employees - assets she brought when she joined Cerealiq AB almost a year ago. Today, she spends most of her time working on the #FSSC 22000 certification, making sure that our enzyme mixing facility meets the highest quality standards ü§© . This means building and continuously improving routines, educating the employees, and keeping track of all necessary documentation. Her favourite way to enjoy oat drink is by adding spices for a heart-warming cup of ‚Äúgolden latte‚Äù, or when raw-inspired baking at home for her family! #team #oatmilk

Meet our Product Developer, Klelia Karagiannaki! As a Dietitian with an MSc degree in Food Innovation and Product Design (FIPDes), Klelia is passionate about plant-based development, aiming to prioritise the health of humans, animals, and the planet. Her experience in Dietetics and Nutrition Education, Research, and Recipe and Product Development brings an integral scope to the development of food products. Since she joined Cerealiq AB, she has been working hands-on with developing new enzyme systems and products, tailored to our customers‚Äô needs. In other words, making several litres of plant-based drinks every day! Upon transferring the product from the laboratory to a full-production scale, she plans and performs all the needed shelf-life analyses to ensure optimum taste and functionality. Klelia also spends a lot of time reading scientific articles, attending webinars, and following the trends in the plant-based market, often bringing interesting products for the team to taste and test. She is privileged to taste all the drinks warm straight from the trials, which is when she enjoys them the most üòá ! -photo by Rebecca Mattsoff, who invited Klelia to speak about her role in Cerealiq at an entrepreneurship boot camp at VentureLab by Lund University- #team #oatmilk

Meet our CTO, Emilie Sellman! Emilie has been working in the food industry since she finished her MSc degree in Biotechnology in 2006. In her career as Development Engineer, Product Developer and Project Leader in companies such as Culinar, Oatly and Findus, she has been involved in all development stages of a wide range of food products. Her solid experience in the development of plant-based drinks was one of the reasons Cerealiq AB was born in 2018. Emilie co-founded the company and brought her deep knowledge of enzymes and food processing to adapt to customer needs and help them reach their goals. In other words, the recipe for producing the best oat drink! In daily business, she spends most of her time leading forward the development of new enzyme mixes and making sure the enzyme mixing facility runs smoothly. Emilie is also the owner of Trixie, the office dog, which provides the most loving and playful breaks for the employees üê∂ ‚ù§Ô∏è Her favourite way of enjoying oat drink is pouring its warm froth into espresso coffee ‚òï . The second place takes overnight oats with raspberries and cardamom. #team #oatmilk

Meet our Sales Manager, J√∂rgen Kamph! J√∂rgen has robust experience in Marketing and Sales for more than 30 years in the food industry, in organisations such as Guldf√•geln, and Tetra Pak. From 2014 to 2022 he worked as Head of Marketing and Sales at Trensums Food, where he got acquainted with plant-based drinks and developed a wide understanding of such food processing and packaging. Since 2021, he has been working as a consultant, focused on business development in food technology and liquid food production. His experience and network are vital for Cerealiq AB to grow and spread its values for efficient and nutritious plant-based drinks. At the same time, he also assists potential and existing customers in finding the right enzyme technology from Cerealiq‚Äôs portfolio to optimise their products and ensure success in the marketplace. J√∂rgen and his family love to use oat drink in cooking and baking ü•û #team #oatmilk

Meet our Senior Advisor and Chairwoman of the Board, Angie Triantafyllou! During her Ph.D. work in Biotechnology at Lund University, Angie specialised in Enzyme Technology. She is the inventor of several patents and co-founder of Oatly where she worked for 23 years, completing her contribution as Head of Research. Her extensive, genuine knowledge of creating and manufacturing plant-based products of high value, using enzyme technology and advanced product development is very well recognised. In 2012, she received the Innovator of the Year prize in Landskrona and, in 2021, together with Richard √ñste, was awarded the prestigious Polhem Prize. Her long experience does not only involve the food industry and the development of innovative foods but also the academic world, as she is an author of many scientific papers in the field of Food and Nutrition. Angie joined the founders of Cerealiq AB in 2019 sharing the same passion for bringing truly tasty, nutritious, and purpose-built products to customers in a global context. Her multi-disciplinary background provides important insights into business ventures and brand development that attract the modern consumer. Angie enjoys double oats for breakfast. A delicious oat porridge made with oat drink ü•£ , a morning kick-starter! -photo courtesy of Pernilla Pettersson- #team #oatmilk
